Used to prevent griefing attacks.","params":{"newMax":"New maximum deposit limit"}},"setTotalDeposit(bytes32,address,uint256)":{"details":"Uses SafeERC20 to handle non-standard tokens and measures actual balance change for fee-on-transfer tokensOnly the participant themselves can deposit (msg.sender must equal participant)","params":{"channelId":"The channel identifier","participant":"The participant address to deposit for","totalDeposit":"The new total deposit amount (must be >= current deposit)"}},"settleChannel(bytes32)":{"details":"Can only be called after challenge period expires","params":{"channelId":"The channel identifier"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). closeChannel(bytes32,(bytes32,uint256,ui.details: Initiates challenge period, allowing counterparty to submit newer state

params.signature: EIP-712 signature of the balance proof

params._token: The address of the ERC20 token

cooperativeSettle(bytes32,(bytes32,uint2.details: Requires matching balance proofs from both participantsBoth participants must sign proofs with same nonce (mutual agreement)

emergencyTokenRecovery(address,address,u.details: ONLY use if channel in invalid state and participants cannot withdrawContract MUST be paused before calling this functionIntended for exceptional circumstances only (e.g., contract upgrade)

forceCloseExpiredChannel(bytes32).details: Anyone can call this function to clean up old channelsPrevents indefinite fund locking if one participant disappears

getChannelParticipants(bytes32).details: Returns participants in ordered form (min, max)

openChannel(address,uint256).details: Participants are ordered deterministically (min, max) to prevent duplicate channels

params.participant2: The address of the second participant

returns._0: channelId The unique identifier for the created channel

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: Can only be called by contract owner. Prevents all state-changing functions.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setMaxDeposit(uint256).details: Can only be called by contract owner. Used to prevent griefing attacks.

setTotalDeposit(bytes32,address,uint256).details: Uses SafeERC20 to handle non-standard tokens and measures actual balance change for fee-on-transfer tokensOnly the participant themselves can deposit (msg.sender must equal participant)

params.participant: The participant address to deposit for
params.totalDeposit: The new total deposit amount (must be >= current deposit)

settleChannel(bytes32).details: Can only be called after challenge period expires

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: Can only be called by contract owner. Restores normal functionality.

updateNonClosingBalanceProof(bytes32,(by.details: Allows counterparty to submit newer state to prevent fraud

params.signature: EIP-712 signature of the balance proof

withdraw(bytes32,(bytes32,address,uint25.details: Allows reducing locked capital without full settlement

BALANCE_PROOF_TYPEHASH().notice: EIP-712 type hash for BalanceProof struct

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().notice: EIP-712 domain separator for signature verification

MAX_CHANNEL_LIFETIME().notice: Maximum channel lifetime (1 year) - channels can be force-closed after this (Story 8.5)

WITHDRAW_PROOF_TYPEHASH().notice: EIP-712 type hash for WithdrawProof struct (Story 8.5)

channelCounter().notice: Global channel counter for unique channel IDs

channels(bytes32).notice: Mapping from channel ID to Channel struct

closeChannel(bytes32,(bytes32,uint256,ui.notice: Closes a payment channel with balance proof from non-closing participant

constructor.notice: Creates a new TokenNetwork for a specific ERC20 token

cooperativeSettle(bytes32,(bytes32,uint2.notice: Cooperatively settles channel bypassing challenge period

emergencyTokenRecovery(address,address,u.notice: Emergency function to recover tokens stuck in contract

forceCloseExpiredChannel(bytes32).notice: Force-closes an expired channel after MAX_CHANNEL_LIFETIME

getChannelDeposit(bytes32,address).notice: Get the deposit amount for a participant in a channel

getChannelParticipants(bytes32).notice: Get the participants of a channel

getChannelState(bytes32).notice: Get the current state of a channel

hasActiveChannel(bytes32).notice: Mapping to track active channels per participant pair (prevents duplicates)

maxDeposit().notice: Maximum deposit limit per channel (default: 1M tokens with 18 decimals)

openChannel(address,uint256).notice: Opens a new payment channel between two participants

pause().notice: Pauses all channel operations in case of emergency

setMaxDeposit(uint256).notice: Updates the maximum deposit limit per channel

setTotalDeposit(bytes32,address,uint256).notice: Deposits tokens into a channel for a specific participant

settleChannel(bytes32).notice: Settles a closed channel and distributes final balances

token().notice: The ERC20 token this TokenNetwork manages

unpause().notice: Unpauses channel operations after emergency is resolved

updateNonClosingBalanceProof(bytes32,(by.notice: Updates balance proof from non-closing participant during challenge period

withdraw(bytes32,(bytes32,address,uint25.notice: Withdraw funds during channel lifetime with counterparty signature
